direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve modifying the list at a specific index, but 'add' inserts a new element while 'set' replaces an existing one.
Both methods modify the list at a specific index, but 'remove' deletes an element while 'set' replaces it.
The 'set' method relies on the 'get' method to retrieve the current element at the specified index before replacing it.
Both methods involve operations related to finding or modifying elements based on their index.
Both methods modify the list, but 'clear' removes all elements while 'set' modifies a specific element.
The 'set' method modifies the internal structure of the list, which could affect the result of 'toArray' if called afterward.
